name: cli-simple-table
description: When you want to simply display tabular data in a CLI

name: code-inject-loader
description: When you want to apply code transformations to certain files

name: deps
description: When you want to use V8 to identify which package dependencies are being executed

name: esbuild-loader
description: When you want to speed up Webpack with [esbuild](https://github.com/evanw/esbuild)

name: github-cdn
description: When you want to serve static content from a Github Enterprise server

name: htmlvue-loader
description: When you want to import HTML/XML files (eg. SVGs) as Vue.js components

name: i-peers
description: When you want to install your npm package's peerDependencies

name: markdown-it-add-attrs
description: When you want to add attributes to every markdown element

name: md-vue-loader
description: When you want to import markdown files as Vue.js components

name: mempack
description: When you want to run a completely in-memory Webpack build

name: minification-benchmarks
description: When you want to compare modern JS minifiers by performance

name: motion-orientation-api
description: When you want to visualize and understand the data you get from the [Motion & Orientation API](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/native-hardware/device-orientation)

name: postcss-import-alias
description: When you want to use aliases in `@import` statements

name: postcss-custom-properties-transformer
description: When you want to apply transformations to CSS custom properties

name: postcss-preset-env-playground
description: When you want to play with the different [PostCSS preset-env](https://github.com/csstools/postcss-preset-env/) configurations

name: reactive-json-file
description: When you want to automatically save JS objects as you mutate them

name: comment-mark
description: When you want to interpolate strings with HTML comment markers

name: repkg
description: When you want to convert or bundle a npm package (or a specific file) to AMD/UMD on demand

name: rollup-plugin-htmlvue
description: When you want to import HTML/XML files (eg. SVGs) as Vue.js components

name: svg-trace-loader
description: When you want to flatten imported SVGs into a single `<path>`

name: vue-demo-collapse
description: When you want to nicely demo a Vue.js component with a collapsible code section

name: vue-dom-hints
description: When you want to debug a Vue.js app without using [Vue.js devtools](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/vuejs-devtools/nhdogjmejiglipccpnnnanhbledajbpd?hl=en)

name: vue-feather-icon-set
description: When you want to use an optimized [Feather](https://feathericons.com/) icon set for Vue.js

name: vue-frag
description: When you want to return multiple root elements from stateful components

name: vue-import-loader
description: When you want to auto-import & register components used in a Vue.js SFC template

name: vue-just-ssr
description: When you want to add an SSR + HMR dev-env to a Webpack + Vue.js project

name: vue-proxi
description: When you want to proxy Vue.js component props and event-listeners to a child component

name: vue-pseudo-window
description: When you want to bind event-listeners to the window/document via template

name: vue-split-view
description: When you want to create an adjustable horizontal/vertical split-view in Vue.js

name: vue-subslot
description: When you want to pick out specific elements from component `<slot>`s

name: vue-svg-icon-set
description: When you want to create an optimized icon-set in Vue.js using Webpack

name: vue-vnode-syringe
description: When you want to add attributes and event-listeners to component `<slot>`s

name: vue-v
description: When you want to render vNodes via component template

name: browser-reload-plugin
description: When you want to automatically reload your browser page on Webpack watch builds

name: webpack-dependency-size
description: When you want to track/evaluate dependencies bundled into a Webpack build

name: webpack-distsize
description: When you want to track Webpack distribution size in version control
